header_summary:
Antoine Riard discusses the evolution of Bitcoin Core's development culture, highlighting the initial contributions from veterans and cypherpunks, and how the culture shifted towards caution and less rigorous debate post the "block size war." This shift led to a preference for professionalizing the space, impacting the process of awarding open-source grants and encouraging a less adversarial review process, potentially affecting the safety of users' funds. The community has been exploring solutions such as forking the core and establishing multiple security mailing lists to maintain collaborative culture and address security concerns transparently. [Read more](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/Zp6TTAJ399CKbY5s@petertodd.org/T/#mb46ac8857c6aeaad982ae33610c78ae238205302)

Luke Dashjr's dialogue on the challenges of block withholding in decentralized mining emphasizes that decentralization might improve the detection of such activities. Skepticism is expressed towards proposals that might inadvertently favor centralized operations, with a call for more nuanced solutions that do not disadvantage any mining structure. The conversation also explores innovative techniques like zero-knowledge proofs for affirming block validity, and the consideration of hardforks to address enduring vulnerabilities. [Explore further](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/6f7feb2b-2e24-4081-b555-db69f34d308e@dashjr.org/T/#m6d16483cdef824b1b673cd9c7ca9a57a78b76570)

Greg Sanders raises concerns about version 3 (v3) user experience, particularly the lack of flexibility in choosing confirmation speeds and the challenges this poses for wallets not regularly online. This discussion underlines the trade-offs between implementing new functionalities and maintaining user autonomy, suggesting that alternatives like TRUC or the proposed "v4" might offer more practical solutions for various types of wallet usage. [Further details](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/v3-and-some-possible-futures/523/6)

Sipa introduces a sophisticated strategy for cluster mempool management aimed at maximizing fee yield through optimal transaction selection and block construction. This approach involves precomputed absorption sets for more granular selection without needing mutable data structures at runtime, highlighting the efficiency and potential of such algorithms in enhancing block building processes. recent_posts.title: A "Free" Relay Attack Taking Advantage of The Lack of Full-RBF In Core
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core's development evolved, influenced by contributor backgrounds and technical debates.
- Shifts after the block size war led to a cautious approach and less rigorous technical standards.
- Recent efforts focus on improving security practices and fostering a better review culture among contributors.

recent_posts.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
recent_posts.summary:
- Block withholding in decentralized mining is challenging to detect, but decentralization may help.
- Proposed solutions for block withholding highlight the need for nuanced approaches that don't favor centralized mining.
- Discussions include using zero-knowledge proofs for block validity and contemplating a hardfork for major issues.

recent_posts.title: V3 and some possible futures
recent_posts.summary:
- Version 3 user experience may limit confirmation speed choices, requiring fast confirmations.
- This requirement challenges users with "colder" wallets that aren't always online.
- Skepticism arises regarding the desirability of v3 over alternatives like TRUC or "v4."

recent_posts.title: Cluster mempool: block building with sub-chunk granularity
recent_posts.summary:
- Sophisticated strategies construct block templates by clustering transactions based on fee rates.
- Refined construction incorporates subsets of chunks to optimize block space and increase fee yield.
- The use of precomputed absorption sets and branch-and-bound algorithms enhances transaction selection efficiency.

recent_posts.title: Hyperion: A discrete time network event simulator for Bitcoin (Core)
recent_posts.summary:
- The revival of Erlay aims to improve Bitcoin node bandwidth efficiency.
- Hyperion, a network simulator, was developed to analyze transaction dissemination within Bitcoin.
- The project seeks contributions to refine and integrate Erlay functionalities into Hyperion.

active_posts.title: A "Free" Relay Attack Taking Advantage of The Lack of Full-RBF In Core
active_posts.summary:
- The vulnerability in Bitcoin's transaction relay can be fixed by enabling full Replace-By-Fee (RBF).
- TRUC/V3 transactions are criticized for not addressing free relay attacks, despite known vulnerabilities.
- The attack, exploiting low fee-rate transactions, highlights inefficiencies and security concerns in Bitcoin's protocol.

active_posts.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
active_posts.summary:
- Stratum V2's template distribution via client push faces impracticality due to block withholding risks.
- A proposed solution includes a negotiated template approach to enhance security and MEV resistance.
- The email advocates for significant alterations in bitcoin mining protocols for improved security and decentralization.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The analysis discusses Bitcoin protocol vulnerabilities, recommending improvements for security and efficiency.
- It proposes rectifying the timewarp exploit and mitigating risks from non-SegWit transactions.
- Community debate surrounds the block size reduction, with standardization proposals receiving skepticism.

active_posts.title: Who will run the CoinJoin coordinators?
active_posts.summary:
- The crackdown on privacy tools has drastically changed Bitcoin privacy services.
- BTCPay Server CoinJoin plugin introduces self-hosted coordinator services using WabiSabi protocol.
- Author set up their own BTCPay coordinator, offering local users enhanced transaction privacy.

active_posts.title: Stable Channels - peer-to-peer dollar balances on Lightning
active_posts.summary:
- Stable Channels integrates bitcoin with the Lightning network to create dollar balances.
- It aims to reduce bitcoin's volatility and increase the Lightning network's appeal and investment.
- The project offers a decentralized financial stability solution, broadening cryptocurrency's use and appeal.

today_in_history_posts.title: BIP Proposals for Output Script Descriptors
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Andrew Chow proposes formalizing Output Script Descriptors in seven BIPs for Bitcoin.
- The proposal includes various descriptors to improve wallet backups and exports.
- Descriptors have been part of Bitcoin Core since version 0.17, expanding in version 22.0.

today_in_history_posts.title: Turbo channels spec?
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A new proposal allows early `funding_locked` messages without features, relying on trust or sole funding.
- Senders must set `short_channel_id` for route hints and may fake it for routing, re-sending upon change.
- Receivers should ignore `funding_locked` with mismatched `short_channel_id`, until the real funding transaction is mined.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Investment strategies are divided into passive and active types.
- Passive investing's issues include misaligned interests and underutilized assets.
- Proposes central banks could stabilize economies using inflationary and deflationary currencies.
